Key Match Events: Malik Monk scored 31 points, DeMar DeRozan added 29 and the Sacramento Kings beat the Memphis Grizzlies 138-130
Others: Deâ€™Aaron Fox added 23 points for the Kings
Jaylen Wells had 30 and Jarren Jackson Jr. scored 28 for the Grizzlies
The Kings led 78-72 at halftime and 102-100 after three quarters
Zach Edey returned from a two-game absence due to a concussion and had nine points and seven rebounds off the bench
Ja Morant (right AC joint strain) and Marcus Smart (right index finger) did not play. Keegan Murray missed his second straight game for the Kings
Takeaways: The Kings dished out 21 assists in the first half. Three players had four or more
Key moments: The teams combined for 150 points in the first half. The Kings made 29 of 59 shots from the field (52.7%) while the Grizzlies knocked down 26 of 50 shots (52%)
Key stats: The teams made 17 3-pointers combined in the first quarter. The Kings were 10 of 18 while the Grizzlies made 7 of 11
Up next: The Kings travel to San Francisco to play the Golden State Warriors on Sunday. The Grizzlies end their five-game road stretch at the Warriors on Saturday
